label: FGWREU-111
info_overview:
Smart wall switch designed to control motors of roller blinds, awnings, venetian blinds and other single phase, AC powered devices via Z-Wave network.

It measures active power and energy consumed by the controlled load.

You can install it with provided cover plate and switch button or other compatible.
info_inclusion:
Z-Wave device learning mode, allowing to add the device to existing Z-Wave network:

  1. Power the device.
  2. Set the main controller into the adding mode (OH2: search for new things, select Z-Wave binding).
  3. Quickly, three times click one of the buttons.
  4. If you are adding in Security S2 Authenticated, input the underlined part of the DSK (label on the bottom of the box).
  5. LED will start blinking yellow, wait for the adding process to end.
  6. Adding result will be confirmed by the Z-Wave controller’s message and the LED frame:
    • Green – successful (non-secure, S0, S2 non-authenticated),
    • Magenta – successful (Security S2 Authenticated),
    • Red – not successful.
info_exclusion:
Z-Wave device learning mode, allowing to remove the device from existing Z-Wave network. Removing also results in resetting the device to factory defaults:

  1. Power the device.
  2. Set the main controller in remove mode (see the controller's manual).
  3. Quickly, three times click one of the buttons.
  4. LED will start blinking yellow, wait for the removing process to end.
  5. Successful removing will be confirmed by the Z-Wave controller’s message and red LED colour.

} ], "parameters": [ { "id": 11, "label": "LED frame colour when moving", "description": "This parameter defines the LED colour when the motor is running.", "overview": "

        0 \u2013 LED disabled<\/p>

        1 \u2013 White<\/p>

        2 \u2013 Red<\/p>

        3 \u2013 Green<\/p>

        4 \u2013 Blue<\/p>

        5 \u2013 Yellow<\/p>

        6 \u2013 Cyan<\/p>

        7 \u2013 Magenta<\/p>", "size": 1, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 1, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 7, "options": [] }, { "id": 12, "label": "LED frame \u2013 colour when not moving", "description": "This parameter defines the LED colour when the device motor is not running.", "overview": "

        0 \u2013 LED disabled<\/p>

        1 \u2013 White<\/p>

        2 \u2013 Red<\/p>

        3 \u2013 Green<\/p>

        4 \u2013 Blue<\/p>

        5 \u2013 Yellow<\/p>

        6 \u2013 Cyan<\/p>

        7 \u2013 Magenta<\/p>", "size": 1, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 0, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 7, "options": [] }, { "id": 13, "label": "LED frame \u2013 brightness", "description": "This parameter allows to adjust the LED frame brightness.", "overview": "

        0 \u2013 LED disabled<\/p>

        1-100 (1-100% brightness)<\/p>", "size": 1, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 100, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 100, "options": [] }, { "id": 24, "label": "Buttons orientation", "description": "This parameter allows reversing the operation of the buttons.", "overview": "

        0 \u2013 default (1st button UP, 2nd button DOWN)<\/p>

        1 \u2013 reversed (1st button DOWN, 2nd button UP)<\/p>", "size": 1, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 0, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 1, "options": [] }, { "id": 25, "label": "Outputs orientation", "description": "reversing the operation of Q1 and Q2", "overview": "

        This parameter allows reversing the operation of Q1 and Q2 without changing the wiring (e.g. in case of invalid motor connection).<\/p>

        0 - default (Q1 \u2013 UP, Q2 \u2013 DOWN)<\/p>

        1 - reversed (Q1 \u2013 DOWN, Q2 \u2013 UP)<\/p>", "size": 1, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 0, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 1, "options": [] }, { "id": 30, "label": "Alarm configuration - 1st slot", "description": "Which alarm frames and how the device should react", "overview": "

        This parameter determines to which alarm frames and how the device should react. The parameters consist of 4 bytes, three most sig-nificant bytes are set according to the official Z-Wave protocol specification.<\/p>

        1B [MSB] \u2013 Notification Type<\/p>

        2B \u2013 Notification Status<\/p>

        3B \u2013 Event\/State Parameters<\/p>

        4B [LSB] \u2013 action:<\/p>

        • 0x00 \u2013 no action,<\/li>
        • 0xX1 \u2013 open,<\/li>
        • 0xX2 \u2013 close,<\/li>
        • 0x0X \u2013 no action on LED frame,<\/li>
        • 0x1X \u2013 LED frame blinks red,<\/li>
        • 0x2X \u2013 LED frame blinks green,<\/li>
        • 0x4X \u2013 LED frame blinks blue,<\/li>
        • 0x8X \u2013 dis-able LED frame,<\/li>
        • 0xFX \u2013 LED frame LAPD signal (red-white-blue)<\/li> <\/ul>", "size": 4, "bitmask": "0000000F", "default": 0, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 255, "options": [] }, { "id": 31, "label": "Alarm configuration - 2nd slot", "description": "which alarm frames and how the device should react", "overview": "

          This parameter determines to which alarm frames and how the device should react. The parameters consist of 4 bytes, three most sig-nificant bytes are set according to the official Z-Wave protocol specification.<\/p>

          default: [0x05, 0xFF, 0x00, 0x00](Water Alarm, any notification, no action)<\/p>

          1B [MSB] \u2013 Notification Type<\/p>

          2B \u2013 Notification Status<\/p>

          3B \u2013 Event\/State Parameters<\/p>

          4B [LSB] \u2013 action:<\/p>

          • 0x00 \u2013 no action,<\/li>
          • 0xX1 \u2013 open,<\/li>
          • 0xX2 \u2013 close,<\/li>
          • 0x0X \u2013 no action on LED frame,<\/li>
          • 0x1X \u2013 LED frame blinks red,<\/li>
          • 0x2X \u2013 LED frame blinks green,<\/li>
          • 0x4X \u2013 LED frame blinks blue,<\/li>
          • 0x8X \u2013 dis-able LED frame,<\/li>
          • 0xFX \u2013 LED frame LAPD signal (red-white-blue)<\/li> <\/ul>", "size": 4, "bitmask": "0000000F", "default": 0, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 255, "options": [] }, { "id": 32, "label": "Alarm configuration - 3rd slot", "description": "which alarm frames and how the device should react", "overview": "

            This parameter determines to which alarm frames and how the device should react. The parameters consist of 4 bytes, three most sig-nificant bytes are set according to the official Z-Wave protocol specification.<\/p>

            Default: [0x01, 0xFF, 0x00, 0x00](Smoke Alarm, any notification, no action)<\/p>

            1B [MSB] \u2013 Notification Type<\/p>

            2B \u2013 Notification Status<\/p>

            3B \u2013 Event\/State Parameters<\/p>

            4B [LSB] \u2013 action:<\/p>

            • 0x00 \u2013 no action,<\/li>
            • 0xX1 \u2013 open,<\/li>
            • 0xX2 \u2013 close,<\/li>
            • 0x0X \u2013 no action on LED frame,<\/li>
            • 0x1X \u2013 LED frame blinks red,<\/li>
            • 0x2X \u2013 LED frame blinks green,<\/li>
            • 0x4X \u2013 LED frame blinks blue,<\/li>
            • 0x8X \u2013 dis-able LED frame,<\/li>
            • 0xFX \u2013 LED frame LAPD signal (red-white-blue)<\/li> <\/ul>", "size": 4, "bitmask": "0000000F", "default": 0, "read_only": true, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 255, "options": [] }, { "id": 33, "label": "Alarm configuration - 4th slot", "description": "which alarm frames and how the device should react", "overview": "

              This parameter determines to which alarm frames and how the device should react. The parameters consist of 4 bytes, three most sig-nificant bytes are set according to the official Z-Wave protocol specification.<\/p>

              default: [0x02, 0xFF, 0x00, 0x00](CO Alarm, any notification, no action)<\/p>

              1B [MSB] \u2013 Notification Type<\/p>

              2B \u2013 Notification Status<\/p>

              3B \u2013 Event\/State Parameters<\/p>

              4B [LSB] \u2013 action:<\/p>

              • 0x00 \u2013 no action,<\/li>
              • 0xX1 \u2013 open,<\/li>
              • 0xX2 \u2013 close,<\/li>
              • 0x0X \u2013 no action on LED frame,<\/li>
              • 0x1X \u2013 LED frame blinks red,<\/li>
              • 0x2X \u2013 LED frame blinks green,<\/li>
              • 0x4X \u2013 LED frame blinks blue,<\/li>
              • 0x8X \u2013 dis-able LED frame,<\/li>
              • 0xFX \u2013 LED frame LAPD signal (red-white-blue)<\/li> <\/ul>", "size": 4, "bitmask": "0000000F", "default": 0, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 255, "options": [] }, { "id": 34, "label": "Alarm configuration - 5th slot", "description": "which alarm frames and how the device should react", "overview": "

                This parameter determines to which alarm frames and how the device should react. The parameters consist of 4 bytes, three most sig-nificant bytes are set according to the official Z-Wave protocol specification.<\/p>

                default: 0x04, 0xFF, 0x00, 0x00](Heat Alarm, any notification, no action)<\/p>

                1B [MSB] \u2013 Notification Type<\/p>

                2B \u2013 Notification Status<\/p>

                3B \u2013 Event\/State Parameters<\/p>

                4B [LSB] \u2013 action:<\/p>

                • 0x00 \u2013 no action,<\/li>
                • 0xX1 \u2013 open,<\/li>
                • 0xX2 \u2013 close,<\/li>
                • 0x0X \u2013 no action on LED frame,<\/li>
                • 0x1X \u2013 LED frame blinks red,<\/li>
                • 0x2X \u2013 LED frame blinks green,<\/li>
                • 0x4X \u2013 LED frame blinks blue,<\/li>
                • 0x8X \u2013 dis-able LED frame,<\/li>
                • 0xFX \u2013 LED frame LAPD signal (red-white-blue)<\/li> <\/ul>", "size": 4, "bitmask": "0000000F", "default": 0, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 255, "options": [] }, { "id": 35, "label": "Alarm configuration \u2013 duration", "description": "duration of alarm sequence", "overview": "

                  This parameter defines duration of alarm se-quence. When time set in this parameter elaps-es, alarm is cancelled, LED frame and relay re-store normal operation, but do not recover state from before the alarm.<\/p>

                  0 \u2013 infinite<\/p>

                  1-32400 (1s-9h, 1s step) \u2013 duration<\/p>", "size": 2, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 600, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 32400, "options": [] }, { "id": 40, "label": "First button \u2013 scenes sent", "description": "which actions result in sending scene IDs ", "overview": "

                  This parameter determines which actions result in sending scene IDs assigned to them. Values can be combined (e.g. 1+2=3 means that scenes for single and double click are sent).Enabling scenes for triple click disables entering the device in learn mode by triple clicking<\/p>

                  0 (no scenes)<\/p>

                  1 \u2013 Key pressed 1 time<\/p>

                  2 \u2013 Key pressed 2 times<\/p>

                  4 \u2013 Key pressed 3 times<\/p>

                  8 \u2013 Key hold down and key released<\/p>", "size": 1, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 0, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 15, "options": [] }, { "id": 41, "label": "Second button \u2013 scenes sent", "description": "which actions result in sending scene IDs", "overview": "

                  This parameter determines which actions result in sending scene IDs assigned to them. Values can be combined (e.g. 1+2=3 means that scenes for single and double click are sent).Enabling scenes for triple click disables entering the device in learn mode by triple clicking.<\/p>

                  0 (no scenes)<\/p>

                  1 \u2013 Key pressed 1 time<\/p>

                  2 \u2013 Key pressed 2 times<\/p>

                  4 \u2013 Key pressed 3 times<\/p>

                  8 \u2013 Key hold down and key released<\/p>", "size": 1, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 0, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 15, "options": [] }, { "id": 60, "label": "Power reports \u2013 include self-consumption", "description": "power measurements include device itself", "overview": "

                  whether the power measurements should include power consumed by the device itself<\/p>

                  0 \u2013 self-consumption not included<\/p>

                  1 \u2013 self-consumption included<\/p>", "size": 1, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 0, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 1, "options": [] }, { "id": 61, "label": "Power reports \u2013 on change", "description": "minimal change in measured power to report", "overview": "

                  This parameter defines minimal change (from the last reported) in measured power that re-sults in sending new report. For loads under 50W the parameter is irrelevant, report are sent every 5W change.<\/p>

                  0 - reporting on change disabled<\/p>

                  1-500 (1-500%, 1% step) \u2013 minimal change<\/p>", "size": 2, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 15, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 500, "options": [] }, { "id": 62, "label": "Power reports \u2013 periodic", "description": "reporting interval for measured power", "overview": "

                  This parameter defines reporting interval for measured power. Periodic reports are indepen-dent from changes in value (parameter 61).<\/p>

                  0 \u2013 periodic reports disabled<\/p>

                  30-32400 (30s-9h, 1s step) \u2013 time interval<\/p>", "size": 2, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 3600, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 32400, "options": [] }, { "id": 65, "label": "Energy reports \u2013 on change", "description": "minimal change in measured energy to report", "overview": "

                  This parameter defines minimal change (from the last reported) in measured energy that re-sults in sending new report.<\/p>

                  0 - reporting on change disabled<\/p>

                  1-500 (0.01-5kWh, 0.01kWh step) \u2013 minimal change<\/p>", "size": 2, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 10, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 500, "options": [] }, { "id": 66, "label": "Energy reports \u2013 periodic", "description": "This reporting interval for measured energy", "overview": "

                  This parameter defines reporting interval for measured energy. Periodic reports are indepen-dent from changes in value (parameter 65).<\/p>

                  0 \u2013 periodic reports disabled<\/p>

                  30-32400 (30s-9h, 1s step) \u2013 time interval<\/p>", "size": 2, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 3600, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 32400, "options": [] }, { "id": 150, "label": "Force calibration", "description": "Set 2 to force device into calibration mode", "overview": "

                  By setting this parameter to 2 the device enters the calibration mode. The parameter relevant only if the device is set to work in positioning mode (parameter 151 set to 1 or 2).<\/p>

                  0 - device is not calibrated<\/p>

                  1 - device is calibrated<\/p>

                  1 \u2013 roller blind (with positioning)<\/p>

                  For Venetian blinds (parameter 151 set to 2) the parameter determines time of full turn cycle of the slats. The parameter is irrelevant for other modes.<\/p>

                  0-65535 (0 - 655.35s, every 0.01s) - time of turn<\/p>", "size": 4, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 150, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 65535, "options": [] }, { "id": 153, "label": "Set slats back to previous position", "description": "slats positioning in various situations", "overview": "

                  For Venetian blinds (parameter 151 set to 2) the parameter determines slats positioning in various situations. The parameter is irrelevant for other modes.<\/p>

                  1 \u2013 slats return to previously set position in case of the main controller operation, momentary switch operation, or when the limit switch is reached<\/p>

                  2 \u2013 slats return to previously set position in case of the main controller operation, momen-tary switch operation, when the limit switch is reached or after receiving the Switch Multilevel Stop control frame<\/p>", "size": 1, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 1, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 2, "options": [] }, { "id": 154, "label": "Delay motor stop after reaching end switch", "description": "time after which the motor will be stopped after contacts closed", "overview": "

                  1-255 (0.1s - 25.5 seconds)<\/p>", "size": 2, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 10, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 255, "options": [] }, { "id": 155, "label": "Motor operation detection", "description": "Power threshold interpreted as reaching a limit switch.", "overview": "

parameters.label: LED frame colour when moving
parameters.description: This parameter defines the LED colour when the motor is running.
parameters.overview:
0 – LED disabled

1 – White

2 – Red

3 – Green

4 – Blue

5 – Yellow

6 – Cyan

7 – Magenta

parameters.label: LED frame – colour when not moving
parameters.description: This parameter defines the LED colour when the device motor is not running.
parameters.overview:
0 – LED disabled

1 – White

2 – Red

3 – Green

4 – Blue

5 – Yellow

6 – Cyan

7 – Magenta

parameters.label: LED frame – brightness
parameters.description: This parameter allows to adjust the LED frame brightness.
parameters.overview:
0 – LED disabled

1-100 (1-100% brightness)

parameters.label: Buttons orientation
parameters.description: This parameter allows reversing the operation of the buttons.
parameters.overview:
0 – default (1st button UP, 2nd button DOWN)

1 – reversed (1st button DOWN, 2nd button UP)

parameters.label: Outputs orientation
parameters.description: reversing the operation of Q1 and Q2
parameters.overview:
This parameter allows reversing the operation of Q1 and Q2 without changing the wiring (e.g. in case of invalid motor connection).

0 - default (Q1 – UP, Q2 – DOWN)

1 - reversed (Q1 – DOWN, Q2 – UP)

parameters.label: Alarm configuration - 1st slot
parameters.description: Which alarm frames and how the device should react
parameters.overview:
This parameter determines to which alarm frames and how the device should react. The parameters consist of 4 bytes, three most sig-nificant bytes are set according to the official Z-Wave protocol specification.

1B [MSB] – Notification Type

2B – Notification Status

3B – Event/State Parameters

4B [LSB] – action:

  • 0x00 – no action,
  • 0xX1 – open,
  • 0xX2 – close,
  • 0x0X – no action on LED frame,
  • 0x1X – LED frame blinks red,
  • 0x2X – LED frame blinks green,
  • 0x4X – LED frame blinks blue,
  • 0x8X – dis-able LED frame,
  • 0xFX – LED frame LAPD signal (red-white-blue)

parameters.label: Alarm configuration - 2nd slot
parameters.description: which alarm frames and how the device should react
parameters.overview:
This parameter determines to which alarm frames and how the device should react. The parameters consist of 4 bytes, three most sig-nificant bytes are set according to the official Z-Wave protocol specification.

default: [0x05, 0xFF, 0x00, 0x00](Water Alarm, any notification, no action)

1B [MSB] – Notification Type

2B – Notification Status

3B – Event/State Parameters

4B [LSB] – action:

  • 0x00 – no action,
  • 0xX1 – open,
  • 0xX2 – close,
  • 0x0X – no action on LED frame,
  • 0x1X – LED frame blinks red,
  • 0x2X – LED frame blinks green,
  • 0x4X – LED frame blinks blue,
  • 0x8X – dis-able LED frame,
  • 0xFX – LED frame LAPD signal (red-white-blue)

parameters.label: Alarm configuration - 3rd slot
parameters.description: which alarm frames and how the device should react
parameters.overview:
This parameter determines to which alarm frames and how the device should react. The parameters consist of 4 bytes, three most sig-nificant bytes are set according to the official Z-Wave protocol specification.

Default: [0x01, 0xFF, 0x00, 0x00](Smoke Alarm, any notification, no action)

1B [MSB] – Notification Type

2B – Notification Status

3B – Event/State Parameters

4B [LSB] – action:

  • 0x00 – no action,
  • 0xX1 – open,
  • 0xX2 – close,
  • 0x0X – no action on LED frame,
  • 0x1X – LED frame blinks red,
  • 0x2X – LED frame blinks green,
  • 0x4X – LED frame blinks blue,
  • 0x8X – dis-able LED frame,
  • 0xFX – LED frame LAPD signal (red-white-blue)

parameters.label: Alarm configuration - 4th slot
parameters.description: which alarm frames and how the device should react
parameters.overview:
This parameter determines to which alarm frames and how the device should react. The parameters consist of 4 bytes, three most sig-nificant bytes are set according to the official Z-Wave protocol specification.

default: [0x02, 0xFF, 0x00, 0x00](CO Alarm, any notification, no action)

1B [MSB] – Notification Type

2B – Notification Status

3B – Event/State Parameters

4B [LSB] – action:

  • 0x00 – no action,
  • 0xX1 – open,
  • 0xX2 – close,
  • 0x0X – no action on LED frame,
  • 0x1X – LED frame blinks red,
  • 0x2X – LED frame blinks green,
  • 0x4X – LED frame blinks blue,
  • 0x8X – dis-able LED frame,
  • 0xFX – LED frame LAPD signal (red-white-blue)

parameters.label: Alarm configuration - 5th slot
parameters.description: which alarm frames and how the device should react
parameters.overview:
This parameter determines to which alarm frames and how the device should react. The parameters consist of 4 bytes, three most sig-nificant bytes are set according to the official Z-Wave protocol specification.

default: 0x04, 0xFF, 0x00, 0x00](Heat Alarm, any notification, no action)

1B [MSB] – Notification Type

2B – Notification Status

3B – Event/State Parameters

4B [LSB] – action:

  • 0x00 – no action,
  • 0xX1 – open,
  • 0xX2 – close,
  • 0x0X – no action on LED frame,
  • 0x1X – LED frame blinks red,
  • 0x2X – LED frame blinks green,
  • 0x4X – LED frame blinks blue,
  • 0x8X – dis-able LED frame,
  • 0xFX – LED frame LAPD signal (red-white-blue)

parameters.label: Alarm configuration – duration
parameters.description: duration of alarm sequence
parameters.overview:
This parameter defines duration of alarm se-quence. When time set in this parameter elaps-es, alarm is cancelled, LED frame and relay re-store normal operation, but do not recover state from before the alarm.

0 – infinite

1-32400 (1s-9h, 1s step) – duration

parameters.label: First button – scenes sent
parameters.description: which actions result in sending scene IDs
parameters.overview:
This parameter determines which actions result in sending scene IDs assigned to them. Values can be combined (e.g. 1+2=3 means that scenes for single and double click are sent).Enabling scenes for triple click disables entering the device in learn mode by triple clicking

0 (no scenes)

1 – Key pressed 1 time

2 – Key pressed 2 times

4 – Key pressed 3 times

8 – Key hold down and key released

parameters.label: Second button – scenes sent
parameters.description: which actions result in sending scene IDs
parameters.overview:
This parameter determines which actions result in sending scene IDs assigned to them. Values can be combined (e.g. 1+2=3 means that scenes for single and double click are sent).Enabling scenes for triple click disables entering the device in learn mode by triple clicking.

0 (no scenes)

1 – Key pressed 1 time

2 – Key pressed 2 times

4 – Key pressed 3 times

8 – Key hold down and key released

parameters.label: Power reports – include self-consumption
parameters.description: power measurements include device itself
parameters.overview:
whether the power measurements should include power consumed by the device itself

0 – self-consumption not included

1 – self-consumption included

parameters.label: Power reports – on change
parameters.description: minimal change in measured power to report
parameters.overview:
This parameter defines minimal change (from the last reported) in measured power that re-sults in sending new report. For loads under 50W the parameter is irrelevant, report are sent every 5W change.

0 - reporting on change disabled

1-500 (1-500%, 1% step) – minimal change

parameters.label: Power reports – periodic
parameters.description: reporting interval for measured power
parameters.overview:
This parameter defines reporting interval for measured power. Periodic reports are indepen-dent from changes in value (parameter 61).

0 – periodic reports disabled

30-32400 (30s-9h, 1s step) – time interval

parameters.label: Energy reports – on change
parameters.description: minimal change in measured energy to report
parameters.overview:
This parameter defines minimal change (from the last reported) in measured energy that re-sults in sending new report.

0 - reporting on change disabled

1-500 (0.01-5kWh, 0.01kWh step) – minimal change

parameters.label: Energy reports – periodic
parameters.description: This reporting interval for measured energy
parameters.overview:
This parameter defines reporting interval for measured energy. Periodic reports are indepen-dent from changes in value (parameter 65).

0 – periodic reports disabled

30-32400 (30s-9h, 1s step) – time interval

parameters.label: Force calibration
parameters.description: Set 2 to force device into calibration mode
parameters.overview:
By setting this parameter to 2 the device enters the calibration mode. The parameter relevant only if the device is set to work in positioning mode (parameter 151 set to 1 or 2).

0 - device is not calibrated

1 - device is calibrated

2 - force device calibration

parameters.label: Operating mode
parameters.description: This parameter allows adjusting operation ac-cording to the connected device.
parameters.overview:
1 – roller blind (with positioning)

2 – Venetian blind (with positioning)

5 – roller blind with built-in driver

6 – roller blind with built-in driver (impulse)

parameters.label: Venetian blind – time of full turn of the slats
parameters.description: time of full turn cycle of the slats
parameters.overview:
For Venetian blinds (parameter 151 set to 2) the parameter determines time of full turn cycle of the slats. The parameter is irrelevant for other modes.

0-65535 (0 - 655.35s, every 0.01s) - time of turn

parameters.label: Set slats back to previous position
parameters.description: slats positioning in various situations
parameters.overview:
For Venetian blinds (parameter 151 set to 2) the parameter determines slats positioning in various situations. The parameter is irrelevant for other modes.

0 – slats return to previously set position only in case of the main controller operation

1 – slats return to previously set position in case of the main controller operation, momentary switch operation, or when the limit switch is reached

2 – slats return to previously set position in case of the main controller operation, momen-tary switch operation, when the limit switch is reached or after receiving the Switch Multilevel Stop control frame

parameters.label: Delay motor stop after reaching end switch
parameters.description: time after which the motor will be stopped after contacts closed
parameters.overview:
The parameter determines the time after which the motor will be stopped after end switch contacts are closed.

1-255 (0.1s - 25.5 seconds)

parameters.label: Motor operation detection
parameters.description: Power threshold interpreted as reaching a limit switch.
parameters.overview:
1-255 (1-255W) - report interval

0 - no detection

parameters.label: Time of up movement
parameters.description: time needed for roller blinds to reach the top
parameters.overview:
This parameter determines the time needed for roller blinds to reach the top. For modes with positioning value is set automatically during calibration, otherwise, it must be set manually.

1-65535 (0.01 - 655.35 seconds)

parameters.label: Time of down movement
parameters.description: time needed for roller blinds to reach the bottom
parameters.overview:
This parameter determines the time needed for roller blinds to reach the bottom.For modes with positioning value is set automatically during calibration, otherwise, it must be set manually.

1-65535 (0.01 - 655.35 seconds)

commandclass.name: NO_OPERATION
commandclass.label: No Operation - used for PINGing a device.

notices: Endpoint 0 has no command class linked to the basic class.
Endpoint 1 has no command class linked to the basic class.
Endpoint 2 has no command class linked to the basic class.
